snippet: Economists forecast claims slipping to 275,000 last week. The increase probably reflects volatility rather than a change in labor market conditions.
abstract: Labor Dept reports weekly claims for state unemployment benefits rose 7,000 to seasonally adjusted 284,000; says import prices dropped 1.2 percent in December, after 0.5 drop in November.
lead_paragraph: Economists forecast claims slipping to 275,000 last week. The increase probably reflects volatility rather than a change in labor market conditions.

headline.print_headline: New Jobless Claims Rise, and Import Prices Slump
